overall_summary: The reasoning trajectory demonstrates a practical approach to hourly time-series forecasting with limited historical data (96 points). After evaluating multiple methods, the analyst selects a simple averaging technique due to data constraints, focusing on daily seasonality while acknowledging but not modeling a potential downward trend. The solution prioritizes simplicity and interpretability over complex modeling given the 4-day forecast horizon.
common_data_patterns: Potential downward trend (not modeled due to limited data)
No missing values in historical data
Higher daytime values and lower nighttime values
key_insights: Limited data (4 days) restricts complex modeling of trends or weekly patterns
Daily seasonality is the dominant identifiable pattern
Averaging same-hour values across available days provides a robust baseline
Forecast horizon matches historical data length (96 hours), enabling pattern repetition
Output formatting consistency (3 decimal places) maintains data integrity
complexity_analysis: Moderate complexity: Involves method evaluation (SARIMA/ETS/seasonal naive), data decomposition considerations, and trend analysis, but implements a simple, justifiable solution due to data limitations.
